intro: Hesperodoria, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Hesperodoria species typically grow in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to arid conditions. They are often found in mountainous areas and are of interest to botanists due to their unique ecological adaptations.
